reviewText:
There are other offerings for the ten old 'Sherlock Holmes' movies.
So too the Thirty-Nine episodes from a television series around 1954.
These have Ronald Howard as 'Holmes' and are often inspired by the original stories.

The one big advantage of this product is the fifty radio shows from the 1940's when people listened to the radio and television was an idea for the future (altho Great Britain and Germany both had television broadcasts before WW II).

Good old fashioned fun! Being an avid sherlock holmes fan (basil rathbone as my favorite SH actor) I was pleasantly surprised to see this all in one DVD set available. This is the only dvd set that I have seen that includes THIS MANY FILMS IN ONE BOX! ELEVEN DVDS!! I own quite a few of these classic movies separately, however this definitely completes my collection having them all in this one set. Being so old, the transfers are pretty decent, very watchable as me and my husband plan to have a sherlock holmes mystery marathon! Having 10 full length theatrical films plus the ENTIRE 39 TV episodes of "The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes" with Ronald Howard is definitely a plus. The bonus audio cd that comes with this collection is great for me as I have to commute to work (30 minutes everyday) and there are over 50 radio episodes that I can listen to on the way to work. Each radio episode is around 25-30 minutes long which is about my exact travel time so it works out great.

The film listing isn't clear from the description so I've put together the list here:

Dressed to Kill - Starring Basil Rathbone as Sherlock Holmes
Terror by Night - Starring Basil Rathbone as Sherlock HolmesThe Woman in Green - Starring Basil Rathbone as Sherlock HolmesSherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon - Starring Basil Rathbone as Sherlock Holmes
Sherlock Holmes and the Deadly Necklace - Starring Christopher Lee as Sherlock HolmesA Study in Scarlet - Starring Reginald Owen as Sherlock HolmesThe Speckled Band - Starring Raymond Massey as Sherlock Holmes
The Sign of Four - Starring Arthur Wontner as Sherlock HolmesMurder at the Baskervilles (AKA Silver Blaze)  - Starring Arthur Wontner as Sherlock HolmesThe Triumph of Sherlock Holmes - Starring Arthur Wontner as Sherlock Holmes

Complete 39 "The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes" TV Episodes - Produced by Sheldon Reynolds, Starring Ronald Howard, H. Marion Crawford
  1. The Case of the Cunningham Heritage
  2. The Case of Lady Beryl
  3. The Case of the Pennsylvania Gun
  4. The Case of the Texas Cowgirl
  5. The Case of the Belligerent Ghost
  6. The Case of the Shy Ballerina
  7. The Case of the Winthrop Legend
  8. The Case of the Blind Man's Bluff
  9. The Case of Harry Crocker
  10. The Mother Hubbard Case
  11. The Case of the Red Headed League
  12. The Case of the Shoeless Engineer
  13. The Case of the Split Ticket
  14. The Case of the French Interpreter
  15. The Case of the Singing Violin
  16. The Case of the Greystone Inscription
  17. The Case of the Laughing Mummy
  18. The Case of the Thistle Killer
  19. Case of the Vanished Detective
  20. The Case of the Careless Suffragette
  21. The Case of the Reluctant Carpenter
  22. The Case of the Deadly Prophecy
  23. The Case of the Christmas Pudding
  24. The Night Train Riddle
  25. The Case of the Violent Suitor
  26. The Case of the Baker Street Nursemaids
  27. The Case of the Perfect Husband
  28. The Case of the Jolly Hangman
  29. The Case of the Imposter Mystery
  30. The Case of the Eiffel Tower
  31. The Case of the Exhumed Client
  32. The Case of the Impromptu Performance
  33. The Case of the Baker Street Bachelors
  34. The Case of the Royal Murder
  35. The Case of the Haunted Gainsborough
  36. The Case of the Neurotic Detective
  37. The Case of the Unlucky Gambler
  38. The Case of the Diamond Tooth
  39. The Case of the Tyrant's Daughter

I GIVE THIS  5 STARS FOR HAVING SO MANY FILMS IN ONE DVD SET!!!

The only thing I wish it had was some kind of booklet to go along with it that listed all the details/trivia/facts about each of the films and actors.
Maybe they will read this and decide to add something like that in the future!
